text: I joined the 1/6 one project just for more information as far as in what else there are other options to do now let's see an opportunity to get someone else's opinion and have a different perspective on growing cane the success of our p16 one is really around being our able to tailor the recommendations and present them back to the growers so that they any doubts about what they're trying to do is being removed so they can understand the recommendations are suited best practice for their particular farm and then they're quite happy to move forward and and put them into place yeah I thought I was doing everything correctly but I'm with the one six one program we were just stand before my fertilizing program hell of a lot and and just just have this but yeah I have a piece of morning back here monitor you're doing it I'm doing everything correctly to the best of our knowledge of the information that we got the moment we can see a big difference in our property and the lot more advice on one topic than others so we sort of try and tailor our on-farm advice and activities to suit that particular file in the enterprise we focus on the runoff that's leaving farms and entering the reef obviously it's important for us to focus on what's going on on the farm and ensuring that what's being put on with the fertilizer rate is actually what the crop demands the main specific change that we've made by being in the project is dropping nitrogen levels so far it's been really good haven't had any problems that we've conceived by dropping nitrogen rates quite happy looking forward to what's going on especially from a financial point of view as well as anything else so as well as doing it on farm work we also like to run a few workshops one of the main point is to get growers together because growers learned a lot from talking to each other the Google Earth training was useful as we give each grower a USB in that's all their farm data we bought yield maps on their locating of their soil samples any EC mapping that they've done and also their actual nutrient management plan any of the workshops or programs or or seminars or field trips they have whatever us try to get to even if you go to I'm going to only learn one thing that's one thing you didn't know yesterday and it's one more thing you can put in to maintain and sustain a better crop better farm working with pharmacist gives you someone else who's hasn't got a vested interest in selling your fertilizer and also is on your side as far as productivity goes the project gives us confidence that our farm management is the best it can be and that as well as working through the BMP project has given me the confidence that my operation can withstand any scrutiny [Music] you
